doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

description.text: Identify protein-coding regions using Fickett TESTCODE statistic

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The default data file is Etcode.dat and contains coding probabilities for each base. The probabilities are for both positional and compositional information.

xhtml:div.label:
Length of sliding window (value greater than or equal to 200)?
This is the number of nucleotide bases over which the TESTCODE statistic will be performed each time. The window will then slide along the sequence, covering the same number of bases each time.

Stepping increment for the window (value greater than or equal to 1)?
The selected window will, by default, slide along the nucleotide sequence by three bases at a time, retaining the frame (although the algorithm is not frame sensitive). This may be altered to increase or decrease the increment of the slide.

Graphical display?
Yes No
On selection a graph of the sequence (X axis) plotted against the coding score (Y axis) will be displayed. Sequence above the green line is coding, that below the red line is non-coding.
Name of the report file
Choose the report output format Dasgff Dbmotif Diffseq Embl Excel Feattable Genbank Gff Listfile Motif Nametable Codata Regions Seqtable Simple Srs Swiss Table Tagseq
Choose the e_graph output format Png Gif Cps Ps Meta Data
Name of the output graph

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: The default data file is Etcode.dat and contains coding probabilities for each base. The probabilities are for both positional and compositional information.
This is the number of nucleotide bases over which the TESTCODE statistic will be performed each time. The window will then slide along the sequence, covering the same number of bases each time.

The selected window will, by default, slide along the nucleotide sequence by three bases at a time, retaining the frame (although the algorithm is not frame sensitive). This may be altered to increase or decrease the increment of the slide.
On selection a graph of the sequence (X axis) plotted against the coding score (Y axis) will be displayed. Sequence above the green line is coding, that below the red line is non-coding.

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

parameter.name: e_window
parameter.prompt: Length of sliding window (value greater than or equal to 200)

format.code: ("", " -window=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 200 is required

comment.text: This is the number of nucleotide bases over which the TESTCODE statistic will be performed each time. The window will then slide along the sequence, covering the same number of bases each time.

parameter.name: e_step
parameter.prompt: Stepping increment for the window (value greater than or equal to 1)

format.code: ("", " -step=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]
